raspiejukebox

Class JukeBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • raspiejukebox.JukeBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Lockable

    public class JukeBox
extends java.lang.Object
implements Lockable
    The Music player module. This controls all the music playback, queing and song selection.
    If no track is in the que, will play random songs from the tracks database.
    it is a singleton, call the get() function to get the instance.
    Author:
    Jableaderst

      Adds the given track to the end of the queue

      boolean isLocked() 
      Key lock() 
      void pause()
      Pause the jukebox (if playing)
      void play()
      Plays the jukebox.
      If it is paused, plays from paused point.
      void playNext()
      Stops playback of current song (if needed) and plays next in the queue.
      It skips if there is an error, and continues until either a song worked or an max is reached (The max is determined via the settings file).
      void reset()
      Stops the player and empties the queue, making it appear as new
      void stop()
      Stops playing music, and also deallocates resources

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static JukeBox get()
        Gets the singleton instance of the jukebox.
        Returns:
        The Jukebox

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause the jukebox (if playing)

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays the jukebox.
        If it is paused, plays from paused point. If stopped, plays next song in the queue.
        If it errors it skips to the next track

      • addToQueue

        public void addToQueue(TracksDatabase.Track t)
        Adds the given track to the end of the queue

      • playNext

        public void playNext()
        Stops playback of current song (if needed) and plays next in the queue.
        It skips if there is an error, and continues until either a song worked or an max is reached (The max is determined via the settings file).
        If the music was already paused, it will load the next track without playing it

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops playing music, and also deallocates resources

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Stops the player and empties the queue, making it appear as new

      • getState

        public JukeBox.State getState()
        Gets the current state of the jukebox

      • getQueue

        public java.util.Collection<TracksDatabase.Track> getQueue()
        Gets a read only version of the current queue.
        Does not include the currently playing track, the next track to play is at index 0.
        If queue is empty, returns empty array

      • addStateChangeListener

        public void addStateChangeListener(JukeBoxListener jbl)

      • getCurrentTrack

        public TracksDatabase.Track getCurrentTrack()
        Gets the currently playing track
